result.execSummary:
The defendant Glyn Hamilton Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation today. Probation may petition for early discharge after 1.5 years.

miscConds.notes: Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations or follow thru with current assessment.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules/conditions/programming per agent.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release, no good time. Stayed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glyn Hamilton Sullivan

Count 2-DRI
22TR566 & 22TR567-dismissed
CT finds def waiving PSI

SENTENCE:
22CF159-poss meth-w/h, probation up to 3 yrs. 12 mo CT, subj to WR no GT-stayed. AODA & compliance or follow thru w/ current assmt. No controlled substances. No contact w/ users. Must follow rules/programming of probation. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $300.05 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Must report to probation today. 5 days credit. PCR. 12:06 pm adj.
